snippet: The censorship of influenza research will do little to prevent its misuse — and it may hinder our ability to stop influenza outbreaks.
abstract: Op-Ed article by Prof Howard Markel contends that the National Science Advisory Board for Biosecurity's request that journals Nature and Science not publish details about highly transmissible form of Avian flu amounts to censorship; warns scientific compliance with request will do little to prevent misuse of the virus, and may hinder the capacity of the community to stop future outbreaks.
lead_paragraph: The censorship of influenza research will do little to prevent its misuse — and it may hinder our ability to stop influenza outbreaks.
